description: From Middle English despoylen, dispoylen, from Old French despoillier ( > French dépouiller), from Latin dēspoliō, dēspoliāre.

verbs.description: despoil (third-person singular simple present despoils, present participle despoiling, simple past and past participle despoiled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To plunder; to pillage; take spoil from.
examples: To dreamers in the West, Tibet is a Shangri-La despoiled by Chinese ruthlessness and rapacity.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To violently strip (someone), with indirect object of their possessions etc.; to rob.
(obsolete, transitive or reflexive) To strip (someone) of their clothes; to undress.
